advertisement

Student activism rises as apathy becomes something of the past

Demonstrators have already succeeded no matter who divests and how quickly PERIOD Even if they dont change the world they have already obliterated the notion that there is a generation that doesnt care PERIOD

This quote comes from Newsweek news analyst Dennis A PERIOD Williams in speaking about renewed activism among U.S PERIOD students protesting against South Africa Apartheid PERIOD

The  students who stood on Old Main lawn May  protesting the Universitys . million investments in companies doing business in South Africa put into motion what many student leaders and University administrators are now calling 

The characteristics student leaders and administrators see in the student activist are organization cooperation the need to do research and a confidence that the system will hear the students voices PERIOD

University Director for Student Services John T PERIOD Eakin believes the divestment issue marks a dramatic shift in student concern since the late 1970s reflecting the students new willingness to become involved in campus or national issues PERIOD

That period Eakin said found colleges and universities to be fairly quiet places PERIOD Students oriented toward their own personal concerns such as their education and their carreers and gave less attention to issues going on beyond campus he said PERIOD

 Eakin said PERIOD



Eakin said he finds many professional people talking about it who are involved in student affairs and student work PERIOD

Undergraduate Student Government President David Rosenblatt said student activism had a healthy growth period last year especially in the form of increased voter registration and demonstrations over Apartheid PERIOD

Originally Rosenblatt did not support the USG Senate resolution that called for the University to divest PERIOD His decision was based on the belief that the majority of students did not understand the full ramifications of the resolution PERIOD

 Rosenblatt said PERIOD

 he added 

This summer USG Senate President David R PERIOD Rishell initiated a successful request asking the Universitys Board of Trustees to postpone their decision on University divestment until student opinion could be effectively polled during Fall Semester PERIOD

 Rishel said PERIOD 

Rishell emphasized the need to protest in ways that the administration understands PERIOD

 Rishell said PERIOD 

University antiApartheid demonstrations were on a smaller scale in comparison to other campuses Rishell said but they were still impressive for Penn State PERIOD

 Rishell said 

Rishell and Rosenblatt said they gained a positive impression on the past years USG voter registration drive PERIOD

 Rishell said PERIOD

An estimated  new voters registered last year with over  from University Park PERIOD

Rosenblatt said the voter drive will have a longrange impact only if the drive continues to meet with annual success 

 Rosenblatt said PERIOD

Rosenblatt added he nevertheless recognizes a future challenge for the USG and other student service organizations PERIOD

 he said PERIOD

Eakin emphasized that everyone should wait and not prematurely say that the activism of the 60s will return PERIOD

 he said PERIOD

 he added PERIOD
